column4: i have ubuntu server install, and i would like to stream my mpeg2(.mpg) movies over the internet to my school. what server application(or anything for that matter) would do this? i think it would need to be compressed.
nc, mplayer, vlc, or more complex, webserver
preferably in place, so i don't have extra files lying around
Compressing? ffmpeg and mencoder can do a lot, but rather not on fly.
i just don't know if my internet connection will support a 6gb(total) stream
self hosted at my house. i would like to stream to my school.
What upstream? There is many free webhostings with php, so easy to set proper steam, you need 100kbps for each connection and average video quality.
i am happy with a 1mb upstream from the house to the school. won't mpeg2 take more than 100kbps?
1 mega bit? It is 130 kile byte.
yes 1 mbit/s. i've read that you need more like 2-4mbit/s for mpeg 2
It is hard to provide high quality stream on home connection, best bet is to reduce quality, or get server with good connection.

i will look into convert/stream. vlc might be able to do what i'm looking for. i just want to keep this accessible to only me and be somewhat easy to open up a movie whenever i feel like it. that way i can watch it wherever instead of having to throw it on an external
then you would be better with gzip and ssh
i would have to wait for the download to watch it though?
Not really, since you can open file in mplayer and vlc while downloading.
